Trähus-fabr. u. p. a., v. ordf. i Sv. ’snickeri-exp :fören., led. av skolstyr. sed. 04, nämndeman i Handsbörds här. 08-10, landstingsman (h.) 15 o. »ed. 27, ordf. i Fågelfors komm :’S’tämma sed. 12, i tax:nd 13-42, v. ordf. i skolråd sed. 16, ordf. i Aspeland-Handbörds tingshusstyr. 18-34, led. av ’s^kogsv :S’tyr. ^sed. 29, ordf. i komm:fuHm. »ed. 39, hemv rkretsbefälh. 40-42. translated: Ekströmer, Nils Thorsten, civil engineer, industrialist, Fågelfors, born on October 2nd, 1887 in Fågelfors, Kalmar County, to parents Melcher E. and Agnes Carlison. Married to Ingrid Bjerslröm since 1923. They have five children: Melcher (born 1924), Madin (1925), Ebba (1928), Signe (1930), and Gunilla (1933). Ekströmer graduated from the Northern Latin School in Stockholm in 1896, completed his studies at the New Elementary School in 1897, studied at the Royal Institute of Technology (E) from 1897 to 1900, and studied at the Academy of Commerce in Hamburg in 1901. He worked as a bank manager at Fogelfors Bruk from 1901 to 1916, and has been a director and CEO since 1916. He is a member of the board of A-B Klafreströms Bruk, chairman of the Swedish Wood Building Association, a member of the school board since 1904, a lay judge in the Handsbörds district from 1908 to 1910, a member of the County Council (Conservative) in 1915 and 1927, chairman of the Fågelfors Municipal Council since 1912, and a member of the tax council from 1913 to 1942. He is also vice chairman of the school board since 1916, chairman of the Aspeland-Handbörds courthouse from 1918 to 1934, a member of the Swedish Forest Administration Board since 1929, and the chairman of the Municipal Board since 1939. He served as a military officer during World War II, with the rank of district commander from 1940 to 1942. He is a member of the Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences, decorated with the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO), Royal Order of Vasa (RVO), SkytteGM, and IdrottsGM.

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star
